Package org.integratedmodelling.thinklab.api.modelling

Interface Summary
ContextTransformingObservation  
IAccessor Classes implementing IAccessor must be able to handle data provision from either a datasource (extraction) or another accessor (mediation).
IAgentModel An IAgentModel is defined in the specification language as the model for a thinklab agent.
IAnnotation Semantic annotations are essentially models whose result observation is entirely specified, i.e.
IComputingAccessor  
IContext A IContext is a named template to build an IObservationContext for an observation structure.
IContextMapper  
IDataset A dataset is a persistent IContext.
IDataSource  
IDataSource.Transformation Tag interface to construct transformation objects that produce a datasource from another during context mediation.
IEntifiable Implemented by anything which is a physical entity or can produce one or more physical entities.
IExtent An Extent describes the topology of the observable it's linked to.
IExtent.AggregationParameters Returned by getAggregationParameters
IExtent.Aggregator One of these is set into AggregationParameters to properly return the aggregation multiplier for each topology granule.
IIndirectObservation  
IMergingObservation Tag interface to distinguish observations that are capable of merging the states of their dependencies.
IModel The most high-level notion in Thinklab.
IModelObject Tag interface for any object that can be stored in the model map.
IObservation  
IObservationIterator An IObservationIterator is returned by the observe() operation on a IModel.
IScenario  
IState A State is an observation resulting from the contextualization of a stateful observation.
ITopologicallyComparable A topological object can be compared with topological operators to another of a compatible class.
IUnit  
MediatingObservation  
TransformingObservation
